verses.kjv: And it came to pass after this, that the king of the children of Ammon died, and Hanun his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: After this, the king of the children of Ammon died, and Hanun his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Some time later, the king of the Ammonites died, and his son Hanun became king in his place.

verses.kjv: Then said David, I will shew kindness unto Hanun the son of Nahash, as his father shewed kindness unto me. And David sent to comfort him by the hand of his servants for his father. And David’s servants came into the land of the children of Ammon.
verses.web: David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, as his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent by his servants to comfort him concerning his father. David’s servants came into the land of the children of Ammon.
verses.ct: David said, "I'm going to show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, because his father was kind to me." So David sent some of his officials to express sympathy to Hanun about his father's death. When David's men arrived in the land of the Ammonites,

verses.kjv: And the princes of the children of Ammon said unto Hanun their lord, Thinkest thou that David doth honour thy father, that he hath sent comforters unto thee? hath not David rather sent his servants unto thee, to search the city, and to spy it out, and to overthrow it?
verses.web: But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun their lord, “Do you think that David honors your father, in that he has sent comforters to you? Hasn’t David sent his servants to you to search the city, to spy it out, and to overthrow it?”
verses.ct: the Ammonite leaders said to Hanun their lord, "Do you really think David is honoring your father by sending men to comfort you? He sent them to scout out the city, spy on it, and plan its overthrow!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved off the one half of their beards, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their buttocks, and sent them away.
verses.web: So Hanun took David’s servants, shaved off one half of their beards, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their buttocks, and sent them away.
verses.ct: So Hanun seized David's men, shaved off half of each man's beard, cut their robes off at the waist so their buttocks were exposed, and sent them away.

verses.kjv: When they told it unto David, he sent to meet them, because the men were greatly ashamed: and the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.
verses.web: When they told David this, he sent to meet them, for the men were greatly ashamed. The king said, “Wait at Jericho until your beards have grown, and then return.”
verses.ct: When David heard what had happened, he sent messengers to meet them, because the men were deeply humiliated. The king told them, "Stay in Jericho until your beards grow back, and then return."

verses.kjv: And when the children of Ammon saw that they stank before David, the children of Ammon sent and hired the Syrians of Bethrehob, and the Syrians of Zoba, twenty thousand footmen, and of king Maacah a thousand men, and of Ishtob twelve thousand men.
verses.web: When the children of Ammon saw that they had become odious to David, the children of Ammon sent and hired the Syrians of Beth Rehob, and the Syrians of Zobah, twenty thousand footmen, and the king of Maacah with one thousand men, and the men of Tob twelve thousand men.
verses.ct: The Ammonites realized they had made themselves an enemy of David, so they hired mercenaries: 20,000 foot soldiers from the Syrians of Beth Rehob and Zobah, 1,000 men from King Maacah, and 12,000 men from Tob.

verses.kjv: And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.
verses.web: When David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the army of the mighty men.
verses.ct: When David learned about this, he sent Joab out with the entire army and all his best warriors.

verses.kjv: And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the entering in of the gate: and the Syrians of Zoba, and of Rehob, and Ishtob, and Maacah, were by themselves in the field.
verses.web: The children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the entrance of the gate. The Syrians of Zobah and of Rehob, and the men of Tob and Maacah, were by themselves in the field.
verses.ct: The Ammonites marched out and formed their battle line at the entrance to their city gate, while the Syrians of Zobah and Rehob, along with the men of Tob and Maacah, took up positions separately in the open field.

verses.kjv: When Joab saw that the front of the battle was against him before and behind, he chose of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians:
verses.web: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.
verses.ct: Joab saw that he was caught between two enemy forces — one in front and one behind. So he picked the best soldiers in Israel and lined them up to face the Syrians.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the people he delivered into the hand of Abishai his brother, that he might put them in array against the children of Ammon.
verses.web: The rest of the people he committed into the hand of Abishai his brother; and he put them in array against the children of Ammon.
verses.ct: He placed the rest of the troops under the command of his brother Abishai and positioned them to face the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon be too strong for thee, then I will come and help thee.
verses.web: He said, “If the Syrians are too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the children of Ammon are too strong for you, then I will come and help you.
verses.ct: Joab told Abishai, "If the Syrians are too strong for me, come and help me. If the Ammonites are too strong for you, I'll come and help you.

verses.kjv: Be of good courage, and let us play the men for our people, and for the cities of our God: and the LORD do that which seemeth him good.
verses.web: Be courageous, and let’s be strong for our people, and for the cities of our God; and may LORD do what seems good to him.”
verses.ct: Be brave! Let's fight with everything we have for our people and for the cities of our God. And may the LORD do what he sees as right."

verses.kjv: And Joab drew nigh, and the people that were with him, unto the battle against the Syrians: and they fled before him.
verses.web: So Joab and the people who were with him came near to the battle against the Syrians, and they fled before him.
verses.ct: Joab and his troops advanced against the Syrians, and the Syrians broke and ran.

verses.kjv: And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fled, then fled they also before Abishai, and entered into the city. So Joab returned from the children of Ammon, and came to Jerusalem.
verses.web: When the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled, they likewise fled before Abishai, and entered into the city. Then Joab returned from the children of Ammon, and came to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: When the Ammonites saw that the Syrians had fled, they also retreated from Abishai and pulled back inside the city. Joab then withdrew from the Ammonites and returned to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And when the Syrians saw that they were smitten before Israel, they gathered themselves together.
verses.web: When the Syrians saw that they were defeated by Israel, they gathered themselves together.
verses.ct: After the Syrians realized they had been defeated by Israel, they regrouped their forces.

verses.kjv: And Hadarezer sent, and brought out the Syrians that were beyond the river: and they came to Helam; and Shobach the captain of the host of Hadarezer went before them.
verses.web: Hadadezer sent, and brought out the Syrians who were beyond the River: and they came to Helam, with Shobach the captain of the army of Hadadezer at their head.
verses.ct: Hadarezer sent for reinforcements — Syrian troops from beyond the Euphrates River. They assembled at Helam, with Shobach, the commander of Hadarezer's army, leading them.

verses.kjv: And when it was told David, he gathered all Israel together, and passed over Jordan, and came to Helam. And the Syrians set themselves in array against David, and fought with him.
verses.web: David was told that; and he gathered all Israel together, passed over the Jordan, and came to Helam. The Syrians set themselves in array against David, and fought with him.
verses.ct: When David received word of this, he assembled the entire Israelite army, crossed the Jordan River, and marched to Helam. The Syrians formed their battle lines against David and attacked.

verses.kjv: And the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew the men of seven hundred chariots of the Syrians, and forty thousand horsemen, and smote Shobach the captain of their host, who died there.
verses.web: The Syrians fled before Israel; and David killed seven hundred charioteers of the Syrians, and forty thousand horsemen, and struck Shobach the captain of their army, so that he died there.
verses.ct: But the Syrians fled before Israel. David's forces killed the crews of 700 Syrian chariots and 40,000 horsemen. David also struck down Shobach, the commander of their army, and he died on the battlefield.

verses.kjv: And when all the kings that were servants to Hadarezer saw that they were smitten before Israel, they made peace with Israel, and served them. So the Syrians feared to help the children of Ammon any more.
verses.web: When all the kings who were servants to Hadadezer saw that they were defeated before Israel, they made peace with Israel, and served them. So the Syrians were afraid to help the children of Ammon any more.
verses.ct: When all the kings who served under Hadarezer saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with Israel and became their subjects. After that, the Syrians were afraid to help the Ammonites ever again.
